label: Ampoule Records
description: 'Single' isn't just a reissue of Pub's similarly-titled 2002 set, it properly rounds up the Glaswegian dub techno reductionist's first three 12"s and adds a couple of vinyl exclusives. Long-form blunted dancefloor haziness never sounded so lovely: imagine Various Artists/T++, The Black Dog, BoC and Manuel Göttsching locked in a room wth some synths, drum... more

title_full:
ARTHUR RUSSELL

              (Rough Trade / Audika Records)
label: Rough Trade / Audika Records
description:
One of the most important and beautiful albums of the late 20th century...

'World Of Echo' was originally released on vinyl in 1986 on Upside Records and has been an essential but hard to find collectors item ever since. Audika gifted the world this new vinyl pressing a few years back - freshly remastered from the recording sessions, including beatless versions of... more

              (Heavenly Recordings)
label: Heavenly Recordings
description:
Saint Etienne return with their 10th album.

"The album was made largely from samples and sounds drawn from the years 1997-2001, a period that was topped and tailed by Labour's election victory and the terrorist attack on the Twin Towers. Was the optimism of that era a lost golden age, or was it a period of naïvety, delusion and folly? The collective folk memory... more

label: Headphone
description:
Preform brings together a selection of tracks originally recorded around the time of HIA's first album "Colourform", some released on compilations such as the Artificial Intelligence series on Warp Records and the Ambient Dub series on Beyond Records, some previously available only on ‘Live at Oscillate’ cassettes.

description:
Hood’s Chris Adams summons the ghosts of ’94 under his jungle/breakbeat alias Downpour.

Also known as Bracken for his instrumental hip hop output, Adams serves up his first proper release under the Downpour alias in over 20 years, drawing on scattershot digital self-releases for a definitive overview of his work during the past decade. Extant since the late ‘90s... more
